channel.title: Alpha Beta Pruning on Andrea Perlato
channel.description: Recent content in Alpha Beta Pruning on Andrea Perlato

item.title: Alpha Beta Pruning
item.description: body { text-align: justify} Introduction A fascinating aspect of our brain is the Synaptic pruning. One of the grand strategies nature uses to construct nervous systems is to overproduce neural elements, such as neurons, axons and synapses, and then prune the excess. In fact, this overproduction is so substantial that only about half of the neurons mammalian embryos generate will survive until birth. At the same way the pruning in ANN is used to eliminate redundant connections between neurons during the training.
